title: Can we consider changing Kindred's ultimate ability
body:
Kindred ultimate effects range from

_"Well I guess that didn't completely suck"_

to

_"Oh my god. You just sabotaged your team, single-handedly delivering victory to the enemy"_

replies.body:
> "Oh my god. You just sabotaged your team, single-handedly delivering victory to the enemy"

This is the issue with any shared buff effect / all unit effects. You need an additional effect to make it worth it, say like the travel speed boost for allies for Bard's tunnel. Normally, these changes aren't enough to really make a large effect. 

Kindred has no differentiated effect on top of its base effect. I would believe if any changes are to be made, it would be adding this differentiated effect, and not a full rework of it.

As some simple options:

1. The heal can be amplified for allies while remaining the same enemies
2. Enemies also are nearsighted while within the area
3. Enemies also gain a Thronmail like effect while damaging allies in the area, and only this damage will bring them below 10% threshold
4. There are inverse threshold for allies (increase per rank) and lowing threshold for enemies (lowering per rank)
5. Enemies gain a long term Grievous Wounds effect if they hit while at the threshold.
the nearsighted effect alone would make it awesome: actually punishing ennemies who gets in it instead of giving them a clear advantage in 8/10 situations

I think the changed heal amount is the only one that would be balanced and feel good to play with and against.  Nearsight would just suck to deal with.  You're punished currently if you aren't in the area (you're able to die), you shouldn't be directly punished for being in the area too.  Lose-lose situations are just unfun.

The thornmail idea is ok, but is basically just a knowledge check.  If they know what the ult does, it's the same as before.  If they don't know, the ult kills them on its own.

The inverse threshold thing is ok, but personally the heal change feels like it would feel better for both sides.

Grevious Wounds would basically just be a harsher version of the heal change and also possibly destroy some champions (Vlad and Swain for instance) while leaving others relatively unaffected.  Perhaps a very short duration Grevious Wounds would work, to prevent them from healing back up to max instantly (from Redemption and stuff like Swain in Zhonya's).

Basically I'd go with either the different heal values for allies and enemies or the grevious wounds for enemies, changed from long duration to short.  The other options are just to generally punishing and would likely result in the only counterplay being to run away rather than try to stay in there.
Why is being unable to dis a punishment?

Being unable to die is an advantage.  Being nearsighted for the duration most definitely is not.

Kindred's ult is already pretty valuable actually.  It's an instant, aoe invulnerability + heal.  That's why enemies are able to use it too, because otherwise it would be absolutely broken.

Instead of different heal values it could also raise the health threshhold for allies. Allies can't drop below 15/20/25% health while active while enemies stay at 10% at every rank. Would create an automatic power differential that would actually be advantageous for your team.

I just think the increased heal would be healthier because it would keep everyone on each team at closer health levels.  An increased percentage of health as the threshold serves tanky champions far more than squishies which just feels less appropriate for it in my opinion.

That's really just a matter of opinion though.  Either could work, but in my personal opinion, the heal would be healthier overall.
I'm thinking the invulnerability should stick with allies for 1.5 seconds after it's ended or even 2 seconds. Would actually make it an advantageous ability for friendlies.

Honestly it is extremely difficult for you to gain an advantage off of the ulti because you can't end it on-command. That's probably one of the more crucial functions it should've had from the beginning that it never did get. Has the same problem as Maokai's old v.1 ultimate as well (too stationary).

Just those two changes would be enough to make it immensely powerful, maybe even too powerful. Refer to Xin Zhao as an example of a good circular ulti.

I am okay with changing it; I agree that especially after Bard and Taric her ult feels... lackluster. 

It's a shame because it has a *really cool concept* that is *spot on* thematically, but it doesn't translate well into the hectic teamfights of LoL.

I honestly like her ult but the fact that it's an AoE that's fixed to the ground and not moving with her, makes it incredibly windowed. You can save teammates from long range deaths sure but in practical usage, where it matters most in teamfights, you're honestly buying your enemy time to respond or just prolonging their deaths with the actual potential of your larger HP pool also taking a hit due to them fighting you in it.

In any case, the use cases for Kindred's current ult is just as much of a benefit for the enemy as well as yours. When this distinction doesn't exist (between an ally and foe), any ability is a hit or miss and requires just the right circumstances to use it effectively.

Just imagine a skillshot that can both hit your allies and enemies and deals the same amount of damage either way. Would you shoot this ability near your teammate and risk potentially losing them a fight if they move the wrong way or would you hold out on the usage until the shot you need to take was a clean one?
kinda like how they made maokai's ult travel with him(his old one, not his dumb root thingy)

Pretty much.
Might fix her constraint issues but i don't know if this is the right thing to do for her.

They had to remove Maokai's ulti since it gave too many advantages. I honestly would expect the same thing for Kindred if she were allowed to move it, since you'd Flash and screw over enemies that wanted to stay while selectively choosing who lives or dies. Who knows though without testing, eh?

but isn't that the point of an ult? to be a game changer? besides, maokai already had good initiation with his base skills. I don't see why they needed to replace his ult with a tacky wave of roots thingy

Maokai's ult was only benefiting his team and it was pure damage reduction for 10 seconds. That's honestly a lot of time and he acted as a damage battery for his teammates, essentially making his entire team tankier by default. This was obviously a big problem as Maokai just rooted someone and then everyone swarmed around them, hardly even making a dent at trying to save their dying teammate.

Kidnred's ult only makes everyone invulnerable at 10% HP and stops all healing effects and lasts 3 seconds. It works for both enemies and allies alike. So giving her the ability to move the zone with her, where the fights is taking place, might prove a lot better usage wise as Kindred would then have the option to edge her ult just enough for her allies to be in it but not her enemies.

This is pretty much a big dance between good Kindreds and great Kindreds.

Currently we have the option of fed Kindreds showing their skill via controlling their death and damaging the enemy enough to oneshot via E cast and prep. That's already amazingly hard to do for most players since they don't necessarily recognize when they are capable of doing this.

When we involve Taric ultimate, IT DOES NOT BENEFIT THE ENEMY TEAM. It has a prep time due to this, but with Kindred's porposed ult here, all you need to do is run Flash and you can essentially hold the detonation timer of the enemy by witnessing what your teammates are doing. The opponent on the other hand is given no option to really counterplay if you are doing this under the scenarios of:
1. They have no Flash or escapes. (So basically anything immobile without Flash.)
2. They have no CC to stop you. This is already an issue with current Kindred ult that is only kept at bay because you cast it at the center and it cannot move. You are a ranged champion with dashes.
3. They legit cannot move up without guaranteeing their own death. When you do a tower dive for example, Kindred and her allies have to risk taking a huge amount of shots and the timer for the ulti can be misplaced so that you'll still die to the tower in the end. By being able to move it, you essentially have a no risk tower dive scenario which Maokai was also popular for performing. Naturally melee champs wouldn't be able to abuse it with Kindred as easily, but then mid lane and bot lane are an assortment of ranged champs...

On paper already, none of this sounds balanced. Where is the justification of situations in-game that the opponent would capitalize on Kindred based on them being BAD rather than giving an ACTUAL OPTION to counterplay? That'd be no different than pre-rework Azir who was a balancing nightmare.
You're buying time for your team to resume the team fight, so rework the ult into something that lowers the cds of all allies in the area by 3 sec at the end of the portion that her ult stalls for.

I feel like her ult actually doesn't really make sense for her character. She's about taking life, not preserving it. It would make more sense if she had a "marked to die" ult that lasted for a long time. Perhaps giving kindred movement speed towards the target, increasing damage to the target, or some other effect. It could even be stronger if the target is the current mark.

The only way her ult fits thematically is that it has something to do with death.

Though it is kind of a cool ability, I feel it's a large part of what holds kindred back.  If she had an ult with kill potential it could shift her power into more windowed ganking power, which is what she desperately needs imo.

She's incredibly reliant on ganks, and with an ult that rarely helps with ganks that leaves her in a place where she needs strong kill potential with just her base skills to get any stacks at all, which has proven to be pretty unhealthy for a ranged champ. Being a ranged jungler dependent on strong ganks leads to a lot of feast or famine gameplay.
Agreed. Maybe her ult should do the opposite effect in a smaller area that slows and detonates quicker.

You'd think the embodiment of death would have an ult that's actually detrimental for the enemy team

Most of the time a "good" kindred ult comes from enemies just walking out of it because they don't know what it does because _who the fuck even plays this champ anymore_. Feels pretty bad

It is super powerful and as such eats up a ton of her power budget. A Rioter a while back mentioned Kindred will be getting more cha he's in the future but in my opinion they need a full update. Not one part of their kit should remain as is, especially her R and passive. It just doesn't work in any kind of meaningful or effective way.

Yeah, not only does their kit not really work well, it's also not interesting at all. Aside from their ult they don't have anything in their kit that makes them worth picking over someone else and as was pointed out here, their ult doesn't work well either.

The big thing with her ult is you are supposed to E the enemy and proc two stacks so the moment it ends you can get the execute, but that very very rarely kills enemies and if they didn't die to it, it's probably because they're too tanky for that and you being an ADC are probably dead for being so close since her ult is only about 500 or 550 in diameter. It just isn't worth. The only time I have ever found her R to be useful is to put in you and your ADC from behind and stand at the edge shooting into a fight.

I think the power budget her ult eats as well as her weird stacking system that requires her to snowball are Kindred's biggest issues right now.  She needs a mid-level rework, but from what it looks like she's not the biggest one in need of one.
Kindred pretty much got Kalista'd
Entering Kindred's ultimate as the enemy should feel like a risk, not a free advantage against someone who used his ability who's supposed to be the strongest in his kit...

Why would you make it be risky to be both inside and outside of it?

That's the thing, by _not_ being inside of it you make it so that you can die but you can't kill the people you're fighting. Going inside of it doesn't change that last fact, but at least it prevents them from killing you, so when it ends you'll be on close to equal grounds.

Bringing people on "equal grounds" isn't what is supposed to happen when you ult... That sounds like what a masochist would want. It's like saying "malphite should be knocked up at the end of his ult like his victims, that way it'll be fairer for them" and thats completely idiotic

No, how it is now is like how Malphite ult is now. How you're suggesting it should be is like if Malphite ult had global AoE and pierced both spell shields and CC immunity, so you'd have to have something extremely niche like "out of map" effects to avoid it.

Ive always thought some kind of change would be cool because it doesnt sit right with me as it is. I think her ulti would be cool if it made everyone inside immortal as it does now until it detonates and then kills everything inside (ally and enemy). 
I know this would be a pain in the ass to balance but maybe make it so kindred has to be inside in order for it to execute and shorten the radius on it.
IDK, her ult just feels lame to me but i dont really play her.
Her passive is the issue

When the embodiment of Death has an ult that prevents people to die, I mean k.

Pretty much from day 1 of her release I have hated the idea of Kindred's ultimate. Both for practical reasons of hating the AoE Tryn ult and for the lore reason of death itself keeping people alive via not-killing them.

Here is an idea I guess:

Her ultimate could be a fusion with herself and wolf to become a glimpse of her original self with increased auto range and the ability to send out one wolf once that hunts down her marked champion or the last hit champion and it deals increased damage based on the targets missing hp and the wolf denies after death passives.

"Let the hunt begin"

"The dead shall move no more"

To be fair there are a lot of similar abilities in the game now because there are so many champions.

They should make it like shen ult but keep her ultimate the same . Where she can use it on a teammate. Like if your top lane is fighting and is about to die you can ult them. They could go two way with this. Either she teleport to whom she ult or just give them her ult. Imo i think this fits more into her champion.

If its single targeted, if feels like a already existing Kayle ult, teleporting gives it too much like Shen. 

A change is definitely needed, but certain features will have people start calling it a lessor clone of other ults. I provided some options in a earlier comment, but this is certainly a tough problem for this ult.

her ult has 0 reward for being used because every time you do you give the enemy more opportunity to kill you (wait for cooldowns, get healed, they would have died but lived, etc). the only usage it possibly has right now is to prevent a team from finishing baron/dragon for whatever pointless reason because then they'll just kill you when it's over, or to protect yourself/a nearby teammate from a global ult like jinx's. no other point in bothering with it. it's such a waste.
any number of changes would make it 100x better. Don't heal enemies! Heal allies more! Slow enemies that enter it! do literally ANYTHING to make allies want to enter the circle and make enemy's think twice about entering the circle! anything at all! Even just something dumb like "allies who enter get a 5% movement speed boost" or something. literally anything is better than this.

One issue I have is it does not fit at all thematically, kindred is the left and right hands of death and yet their ult revolves around saving people

Idea! Change one of Kindreds'/ Kindred's? other abilities to sort of replace the ult by giving their ally a shield or heal and make the ult more Wolf centered considering how the champion as a whole feels more about Lamb. I'm thinking something that'll give wolf some limbs as he has a quote "Bits of them stick in my claws!" and yet he doesn't have any damn claws.

maybe changing their E to not be such a crucial piece of the kit and make Q or W stronger. As E is their only targeted skill make it give said shield or heal to an ally. And for the ult, I'm thinking Kindred fires an arrow that doesn't do too much damage (im thinking around {{champion:30}}'s early damage or less/more) but if it kills a marked champion they get an additional stack. 

Wolf on the other hand chases the champion with the lowest current health, dealing additional damage if they're being hunted, over the next 5-8 seconds. _Lamb's swift arrow or Wolf's crushing jaws?_

The E would be less crucial for its execute and R would be better for killing targets and then dealing with the remaining champs. Probably overload but just an idea. :P

The change they need to do to her ult is if they want to stick to the mark system every enemy that get the heal from her ult get marked so if kindred kill them they get more marks more easily to make way for more aggressive ult usage rather than just survive.

Hey, occasionally you can find someone who's really good at timing it, and can activate it miliseconds before a teammate dies.

If you can't do that, it's really worthless though. In general, it's a pretty bad ult.
It feels pretty good to flash + Q and save an ally from death.
